channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: O/S No 40, 8th December
item.description:
Caller called to report a problem on the tree in front of house. stated it concern safety issue and reports that the trunk is very wide and takes up a large part of the pavement and prevents access and egress for the general public and for wheel chairs and buggies. Caller is requesting to that a Tree Officer visits and investigates the tree. Please contact the caller who wishes to discuss with a Tree Officer
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenhurst Avenue, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 8th December
item.description:
Loads of household rubbish mattresses, boxes, underlay, etc..being dumped here-people keep adding to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Close, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant pothole at junction of Woolwich Road and Essenden Road, 8th December
item.description:
This pothole has been here for several months and constitutes a hazard to cyclists and motorcyclists. I estimate its size to be 12 inches x 8 inches x 1.5 inches deep. Location is opposite the library
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Essenden Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous slates - someone could get killed, 8th December
item.description:

item.title: Continued rubbish dumping, 8th December
item.description:

item.title: Rags and tacky plastic flowers, 8th December
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned van of rubbish., 8th December
item.description:
The van has been parked there since the start of November full of rubbish that stinks and making visibility difficult when pulling into a main road. I reported this before and was told it had tax until the end of November and must wait until then for you to take action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog waste all over content street and the adjacent streets, 8th December

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Content Street, Walworth, Greater London
